definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: variant of 絡腮鬍子|络腮胡子[luo4 sai1 hu2 zi5]
lit. hair and beard all in one stroke/fig. to handle different things by the same method/one method to solve all problems/one size fits all
pinyin: tou2 fa5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

sentences.english: Look at that slightly stubbly chin.
sentences.chinese: 看那下巴上精心修過的鬍渣。

sentences.english: Men may splash on after-shaudio-videoe lotion or manly-smelling cologne.
sentences.chinese: 男士則拍一些刮鬍水或是男性古龍水在臉上。

sentences.english: He shaved off his beard but kept his moustache.
sentences.chinese: 他颳了下巴上的絡腮鬍子，但仍留着嘴邊的鬍髭。

sentences.english: A few years ago this unshaven look was so popular in America. I thought it was awful.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前在美國很流行不剃鬍須，我認爲這很噁心。

sentences.english: When I suggested that he try shaving cream, he said.
sentences.chinese: 當我建議他用一下刮鬍膏時，他說。

sentences.english: I shaved until I came to the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 我刮鬍須一直刮到我到達停靠站。

sentences.english: To honor the DC, it remains unshaven to this day.
sentences.chinese: 爲了紀念直流，但仍滿臉鬍渣這一天。

sentences.english: I feel i'm growing old day by day…and i even got moustache.
sentences.chinese: 自我感覺是一天天老朽，我甚至有了固定的鬍渣。

sentences.english: As the month begins, you're like a delicious butternut squash: short and sweet.
sentences.chinese: 隨着十月的開始，你就像美味的白鬍桃棒，短而甜蜜。

sentences.english: Because a man’s moustaches come up after his hair.
sentences.chinese: 因爲人們先長頭髮後長鬍須。

sentences.english: It's forbidden for a female to appear unshaven in public.
sentences.chinese: 禁止女性未剃鬍就出現在公開場合。

sentences.english: The long whiskers on a cat's face are coarse hairs.
sentences.chinese: 貓臉上的長鬍須是粗毛。

sentences.english: Hu I-chih of Frisbee World Magazine collects all kinds of frisbees .
sentences.chinese: 飛盤世界雜誌社社長鬍怡之收集的各式飛盤。

sentences.english: The Bearded Man tries to call them, but they RUN OFF, FACES UNSEEN.
sentences.chinese: 鬍渣男子試着呼喊他們，但小孩跑開了，沒看到臉。

sentences.english: Hu Xiadong, deputy minister of railways, is heading to the scene for rescue work.
sentences.chinese: 鐵道部副部長鬍亞東正趕赴現場，指導救援工作。

sentences.english: The barrel of a rifle ROLLS the Bearded Man onto his back.
sentences.chinese: 一根衝鋒槍槍管將鬍渣男翻身到背面。

definition: to confer/to bestow on an inferior/to reward
lots (to be drawn)/lot (in a game of chance)
beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
